H0.text: Physical changes are examples of melting, boiling, and freezing.

H1.text: Chemical changes are examples of melting, boiling, and freezing.

H2.text: Magnetic changes are examples of melting, boiling, and freezing.

H3.text: Electrical changes are melting, boiling, and freezing.

A4.text: Many elements and some compounds change from solids to liquids and from liquids to gases when heated and the reverse when cooled.

A5.text: Many chemical changes are irreversible, and many physical changes are reversible, but reversibility is not a certain criterion for classification.
